The post processor takes the toolpath data generated by the CAM system and converts it into a format that can be read by the machine tool controller. This may involve adding or removing specific instructions, such as tool changes or feed rates, to ensure that the machine tool can execute the part program correctly.

The post processor is an essential part of the CAD/CAM process, as it allows the machine tool to read and execute the part program generated by the CAM system. Without a post processor, the machine tool would not be able to understand the instructions generated by the CAM system, and the part would not be able to be produced.

In summary, a CAD/CAM post processor is a software program that converts the output of a CAD/CAM system into a format that can be read by a machine tool controller. from pydantic import BaseModel

app = FastAPI()

class GroupCreateDTO(BaseModel):

    thumbnail_url: str

    name: str
    thumbnail_url: str

    thumbnail_url: str

    groups.append(group_obj)
    return group_obj

async def get_groups():

            return group_obj
    raise HTTPException(status_code=404, detail="Group not found")
